Key Match Events: Aaron Judge hit a game-tying, two-run home run in the eighth inning off Emmanuel Clase, propelling the Yankees to a 3-2 lead.
Giancarlo Stanton followed up with a go-ahead home run in the same inning, putting the Yankees six outs away from a 3-0 lead.
Jhonkensy Noel hit a walk-off two-run home run in the bottom of the ninth inning, tying the game 4-4.
Gavin Williams hit a walk-off two-run home run in the bottom of the 10th inning, giving the Guardians a 6-4 win.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Boone stated that the Yankees are faced with needing to quickly flush a gut-wrenching loss knowing how close they were to setting themselves up for a potential sweep.
Luke Weaver acknowledged that he was one pitch away from securing the win, saying 'It all stinks. It hurts more knowing how close we were and how big a 3-0 lead would be.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Guardians catcher Austin Hedges claimed that Emmanuel Clase is the best pitcher in MLB history, better than Mariano Rivera.
David Fry noted that when Clase enters the game, the Guardians' dugout often feels like they can stop watching, convinced the game is already decided.
Clay Holmes, who entered the game with a 14 2/3 consecutive scoreless innings streak, allowed a two-run home run in the bottom of the 10th inning.
